div.p: Euclid Avenue was and still is a vibrant part of Ontario, CA. When settling the colony, George Chaffey made sure that all of the colony's wealth and amenities were evident as soon as visitors arrived. A strip was placed in the center of the avenue to allow the trolley to circulate. This trolley not only allowed settlers to travel from downtown to the citrus yards, but it also showed visitors the complex and unique hydroelectric system offered by the colony. Trees were also planted along the strip as part of beautification projects which showed the colony's prosperity.

note.p: Euclid Avenue showed all the amenities the colony offered its settlers, such as a complex hydroelectric system and prosperity.
